title: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution.
text:
At the commencement of this Constitution, every person who has his domicile in the territory of India andâ€”

  • (a) who was born in the territory of India; or
  • (b) either of whose parents was born in the territory of India; or
  • (c) who has been ordinarily resident in the territory of India for not less than five years immediately preceding such commencement,

shall be a citizen of India.
summary:
Art 5 outlines who shall be citizen at commencement of Constitution i.e. 26th Jan, 1950.
It specifies one permanent condition of having domicile in India.
Additionally, the person must also fulfill at least 1 of the 3 criteria:
  • himself born in Indian territory, or
  • either parent were born here, or
  • who has been ordinarily resident for min 5 years before commencement.)
